text:
The joys... The tears... The memories... The nostalgia...

I remember when I was 3-4 years old when my dad played this game. My brother and I watched him play the game with o much astonishment. And, when the story dialogue came, my dad read it out loud translated in Tagalog (my native language) so we can understand.

text: Wahahaha...  samin sa probinsya dati..  nung di pa uso ang pc at internet,  may PS1 rental shop samin,  dun naglalaro yung kuya ko...  dun ko unang nakita tong wild arms,  resident evil,  medievil etc.   pinapanood ko lang sila noon dahil bata pa ako..  pero nung nag download ng emulator si kuya sa pc nun ko lang nalaman na ang sarap palang laruin nung mga nilalaro nya dati sa ps1...  kaya kahit medyo late na para sakin..  may nostalgia factor pa rin dahil naging parte yan ng kabataan ko..  pinapanood ko lang dati..  ngayon nalalaro ko na sa pc at cellphone dahil sa emulator..

text: 1:58 Jack & Cecilia: "Dammit Rudy, there's an easier way up...".
author: SpanishFly120

text: Rudy: "..."
author: Corey Wilson

text: Always felt symbolism there. Think about rudy as a dream chaser and a demon he had to climb his way up nearly losing his grip and nearly giving in until the rising light let  him know his goal was close. While the princess and the treasure hunter both have made their place in the world long before rudy has. Yet regardless they stand and watch the sun rise and the days go by as equals instead of titles. Treasure hunter. Demon. Princess. In the end it doesnt matter. you choose where you stand in this world with enough grit even you can stand with your friends regardless of the blood sweat and tears that followed your past

author: JJitsuBoy98

text:
I just finish Wild Arms few days ago. I admit it is a great RPG, with such beautiful musics, and a lot of good idea (the tools system is great, the fights are great and interesting). But, in the same time, I was playing Final Fantasy VII (for the 4 or 5th time haha), and I think FFVII is better than WA. 
In terms of graphics first, I liked the graphics of WA, but FFVII 3D in the fight is better by far than WA.Then, in terms of story and scenario, the 3 characters of WA have a very interesting background, but the main story is not as great as FFVII (it is my personal opinion). And to conclude, the materia system of FFVII is one of the greatest capacity system of all RPGs I've played, and, even though the Fast Draw technics of Jack are great, it is not as good as the materias.

To conclude, I really liked Wild Arms, the dungeons with the tools are really great, and I had few surprises with the story. Thank you SupraDarky to have me discovered this game, now I'm starting Wild Arms 2 :D
author: ReHawkNRoll

text: Ouch! I'm gonna give you a bit of a warning here: WA2 is not as good as the first one.
author: Gabriel Rocha

text: @Morsh Talon It's the other way around, Wild Arms 2 is a lot better than the first one.
author: DragonishChaosArt

text: @DragonishChaosArt indeed, playing it myself recently, i did not find it nearly as bad as i once remembered. I still prefer the "intimacy" and mostly the pacing of the first one's narrative, and imo it is the superior game, but i wasn't being fair to wa2. My apologies!
author: Gabriel Rocha

text: @Morsh Talon I enjoyed both Wild Arms 1 and 2 a lot. But my favourite is definitly Wild Arms 3, followed by Wild Arms 5 :) But all the Wild Arms game are excellent.
author: ReHawkNRoll

text:
@ReHawkNRoll
I aint the only one! I thought 4 was such a flop I didn't expect 5 to be as good as it was. But 3 is definitely the best one IMO. The music too is just fantastic.
author: Raphael Silva

text: @yamiryushi Yeah WA4 was really disappointing, too linear, and the story is not very good. But it had a good Battle System (I really enjoyed the HEX system), and such a sad ending, I was almost crying !
author: ReHawkNRoll

text:
@ReHawkNRoll
What really messed with me to the point I didn't actually finish the game was the battle system. Not so much the hex system which didn't bother me too much but the numbers. I mean seriously. Why?
author: Raphael Silva

text: I understand it is disturbing because it's very different from the previous WA, but I really liked the strategy aspect of the battle system. :) But I totally agree, there were too many battles.
author: ReHawkNRoll

text: +ReHawkNRoll I think many could agree that final fantasy is better. The series really took off and got alot of chances to try again and perfect their methods compared to this game which didn't necessarily get that. No excuse for the second WA game, but i just love the soundtrack, so thats why im here
author: Caleb Trainor

text:
WA2 is probably the most underrated jRPG of all time and is my personal fav in the series. Better than the 1st one, including the PS2 remake (which was absolutely brilliant BTW).

Also, comparing WA with FF... wtf? It's like comparing Heroes of Might and Magic series with the Warcraft series (respectively). Seriously wtf lol

text: If you have a PSP or a PS3, you can purchase it for about $5 (it might be $10, I forget) from the playstation network. There is also a PS2 remake of this game called Wild Arms: Alter Code F, but it's not quite as good as the original. In any case, do yourself a favor and play the game.
